sentences: Kõik oli selgeks juba enne kohtumist.
context: The Estonian word 'selgeks' is a partitive case form of the adjective 'selge' (clear). It functions as an adverb or indicates completion/transformation into clarity. In the provided dictionary definition, it appears in the context explaining linguistic concepts - specifically describing how boundaries remain clear during agglutination where root and affixes combine to form word forms. The word commonly means 'to make something clear' or 'clearly' when used as an adverb.
